title: Trees Cut In Pune College:10 Fully-Grown Subabul Trees Were Axed Down In This Pune College Campus Ahead Of PM Modi's Visit, Authorities Deny Allegations
text:
For students and sports enthusiasts at Pune's Sir Parashurambhau (SP) college, the gymkhana ground will never be the same again. On Monday evening, several workers took up the work of chopping down nearly 10 fully-grown Subabul trees on the campus.

YouTube

What made the relentless axing worse, is that Prime Minister Narendra Modi's visit coincided with it. While reports claim that the green signal to cut the trees was issued by the Pune Municipal Corporation (PMC) ahead of the PM's visit, the same is yet to be confirmed.

However, authorities deny the coincidence of the tree-chopping to that of PM Modi's visit. The trees were chopped because they 'pose danger to students', they claim.

Even as the trees were being cut on one side of the college area, a stage was being set for the Prime Minister on the other side of the college campus.

Civic workers assisting with the job produced a document that shows how permission was sought by the college management, from the BJP-controlled PMC for this purpose, reports Mumbai Mirror.

Facebook/Mumbai Mirror

The permission letter acquired by Mumbai Mirror stated, 'The trees on the ground have grown in a haywire manner. The trees pose danger due to winds and harsh weather. Hence,, the permission is granted to be trimmed up to three metres'.

Advocate SK Jain, President, Shikshan Prasharak Mandal, told Mid-Day, “There were 16 trees in the area. Last week, a baniyan tree fell on the busy road killing one person. To avoid such incidents, we had to chop the branches and cut around three trees that were dangerous. We sought permission from the Pune Municipal Corporation’s Tree Authority.”

The Bharatiya Janata Party (BJP) strongly emphasized that the trees where being chopped to any avoid untoward incidents. The SP college campus, spread over 24 acres, can accommodate over 50,000 people, reports Mid-day.
description: At least 10 full-grown Subabul trees were severely chopped on the campus of Sir Parashurambhau (SP) College even as its management got permission to trim branches of 16 from Tree Authority of Pune Municipal Corporation (PMC). both the college and local functionaries of the Bharatiya Janata Party (BJP) denied that the axing of trees had anything to do with PM's visit.
